page.title: 07St Mary's Church,Bayford
page.content: {St Mary's Church}is a stone building on the outskirts of Bayford. Built in 1864, it is the second church to be built on this site, the first one having fallen down. It is unusual because of its very {steep roof,}and spire in the middle. The roof causes problems during winter when the hot air rises making the church cold. Churches in this style are associated with France. Inside the church there are items from the old church, including a{tomb {of George Knighton}dated 12th November 1612. However, probably the oldest items in the church are two 16th century brasses on the wall, showing knights wearing chain mail. The most famous person to be buried at the church is{William Yarrel,}famous for his discovery of Berwick's swan.
